natural problem: To be eligible for an algebra class a student must have an average of at least $83\%$ over all four quarters in his or her pre-algebra class. If Fisher had an $82\%$, $77\%$, and $75\%$ in the first three quarters, what is the minimum score he must earn in the 4th quarter to move on to algebra?
natural solution: To average $83\%$ over four quarters, a student must earn a total of $4 \times 83 = 332$ percentage points.
So far Fisher has $82 + 77 + 75 = 234$ percentage points. He needs another $332 - 234 = 98$ percentage points, so he must earn a $\boxed{98\%}$ in the 4th quarter.

a_0.formal problem:
theorem
fixes q1 q2 q3 q4 :: real
assumes h0 : "q1 = 82"
and h1 : "q2 = 77"
and h2 : "q3 = 75"
and h3 : "(q1 + q2 + q3 + q4) / 4 >= 83"
shows  "q4 >= 98"
a_0.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 To be eligible for an algebra class a student must have an average of at least $83\%$ over all four quarters in his or her pre-algebra class. If Fisher had an $82\%$, $77\%$, and $75\%$ in the first three quarters, what is the minimum score he must earn in the 4th quarter to move on to algebra? The final Answer is 98\%
 ### Proof
 To average $83\%$ over four quarters, a student must earn a total of $4 \times 83 = 332$ percentage points.
 So far Fisher has $82 + 77 + 75 = 234$ percentage points. He needs another $332 - 234 = 98$ percentage points, so he must earn a $\boxed{98\%}$ in the 4th quarter.
 *)

theorem
fixes q1 q2 q3 q4 :: real
assumes h0 : "q1 = 82"
and h1 : "q2 = 77"
and h2 : "q3 = 75"
and h3 : "(q1 + q2 + q3 + q4) / 4 >= 83"
shows  "q4 >= 98"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_0.informal problem: The average of four quiz scores is at least 83. The first three quiz scores are 82, 77, and 75. What is the minimum possible score for the fourth quiz? The final answer is at least 98.

a_1.formal problem:

fixes score1 score2 score3 score4 :: real

and h3 : "score4 \<ge> 0"
and h4 : "(score1 + score2 + score3 + score4) / 4 \<ge> 83"
shows  "score4 \<ge> 98"

(* ### Problem
 To be eligible for an algebra class a student must have an average of at least $83\%$ over all four quarters in his or her pre-algebra class.  So far Fisher has $82 + 77 + 75 = 234$ percentage points. He needs another $332 - 234 = 98$ percentage points, so he must earn a $\boxed{98\%}$ in the 4th quarter.
 *)

fixes score1 score2 score3 score4 :: real
assumes h0 : "score1 = 82"
and h1 : "score2 = 77"
and h2 : "score3 = 75"
and h3 : "score4 \<ge> 0"
and h4 : "(score1 + score2 + score3 + score4) / 4 \<ge> 83"
shows  "score4 \<ge> 98"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
